q: Money poisons you when you've got it, and starves you when you haven't.
h:
“Money poisons you when you've got it, and starves you when you haven't.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Living life in style also means living a life of balance.
h:
“Living life in style also means living a life of balance.” —
Jim Rohn

q: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
h:
“We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Do anything, but let it produce joy.
h:
“Do anything, but let it produce joy.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.
h:
“Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.
h:
“Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Show up even when you don't want to show up.
h:
“Show up even when you don't want to show up.” —
Steve Harvey

q: A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.
h:
“A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Do good, live in the most positive and joyful way possible every day.
h:
“Do good, live in the most positive and joyful way possible every day.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.
h:
“Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.” —
Will Rogers

q: Death walks faster than the wind and never returns what he has taken.
h:
“Death walks faster than the wind and never returns what he has taken.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
h:
“The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.” —
Aristotle

q: Imagination is the beginning of creation.
h:
“Imagination is the beginning of creation.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.
h:
“Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great.” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.
h:
“Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too.
h:
“When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
h:
“Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.” —
Carol Burnett

q: The soul is neither born, and nor does it die.
h:
“The soul is neither born, and nor does it die.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Anger, ego, jealousy are the biggest diseases,Keep yourself aloof from these three diseases.
h:
“Anger, ego, jealousy are the biggest diseases,Keep yourself aloof from these three diseases.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Genius, in truth, means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.
h:
“Genius, in truth, means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.” —
William James

q: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
h:
“I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.” —
Herman Melville

q: Nothing you do is going to matter that much in the long run. Don't take yourself so seriously.
h:
“Nothing you do is going to matter that much in the long run. Don't take yourself so seriously.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
h:
“Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.” —
Jim Rohn

q: All know the way; few actually walk it.
h:
“All know the way; few actually walk it. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
h:
“Winners never quit and quitters never win.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
h:
“The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.” —
Ayn Rand

q: True love stories never have endings.
h:
“True love stories never have endings.” —
Richard Bach

q: If you need inspiration, don't do it.
h:
“If you need inspiration, don't do it.” —
Elon Musk

q: Leaders spend 5% of their time on the problem & 95% of their time on the solution. Get over it & crush it!
h:
“Leaders spend 5% of their time on the problem & 95% of their time on the solution. Get over it & crush it!” —
Tony Robbins

q: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.
h:
“It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
h:
“If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: No matter what happens in life, never lose sight of who you are.
h:
“No matter what happens in life, never lose sight of who you are.” —
Yanni

q: Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.
h:
“Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: The significance of life is living.
h:
“The significance of life is living.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Life is simply what our feelings do to us.
h:
“Life is simply what our feelings do to us.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.
h:
“Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
h:
“Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity. ” —
Seneca

q: The best answer to anger is silence.
h:
“The best answer to anger is silence.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Time flies whether you are having fun or not.
h:
“Time flies whether you are having fun or not.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: The future will be shaped by those willing to commit their minds and their bodies to the task.
h:
“The future will be shaped by those willing to commit their minds and their bodies to the task.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.
h:
“The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Inspiration exists, but it has to find you working.
h:
“Inspiration exists, but it has to find you working.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
h:
“Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.
h:
“The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Adults are just children who earn money.
h:
“Adults are just children who earn money.” —
Kenneth Branagh

q: Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.
h:
“Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
h:
“The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.
h:
“Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.” —
John Eliot
